metadata.titel_preek: Christ vs. Adam: Kosovo and Beyond

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The cosmic intervention of God through Jesus Christ to liberate humanity from the ontological captivity of Sin and Death (Adam).

tekstueel_bewijs: God’s action in the death and resurrection of our Lord Jesus Christ has reversed the sin of Adam

object.identificatie: Acquittal, life, and righteousness for all humanity
tekstueel_bewijs: one man’s act of righteousness leads to acquittal and life for all men
The free gift of God is not like the trespass
by one man’s obedience many will be made righteous
taken captive by a power greater than we are, the power of sin and death
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described as a power that 'reigns' and 'dwells within,' making human effort (will) irrelevant to the solution.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The life of the baptized person reflecting Christ's righteousness in the world (Ethics).
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer (e.g., Calvin Johnson)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The ethical life is a consequence of the primary program ('By virtue of your baptism... Now we are ready').

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God → Free Gift of Righteousness → The Ungodly

voorbeelden_god_subject: God’s action... has reversed the sin of Adam
One man's act of righteousness leads to acquittal
voorbeelden_mens_subject: I do not do what I want
We spend our lives trying to deny
You do not belong to Adam

voorbeelden: Let your light so shine (as a concluding result)
I can will what is right, but I cannot do it
Paul wants to make sure we understand this
it can never, ever end unless there is an intervention from beyond

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Inability' (Non-Pouvoir) of man and the 'Power' (Pouvoir) of God's intervention.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Kosovo/Adam) to ~S1 (Self-righteousness/Failure of Will) to S1 (Christ's intervention).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found entirely in S1; the 'Free Gift' moves the subject from S2 to S1 without human mediation.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; S2 is described as a 'terminal case' and 'sweltering caldrons of hate'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon explicitly rejects 'freedom of the will' as a solution and places the agency of salvation entirely on God's external intervention.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of active verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God’s action... has reversed the sin of Adam
The American answer... is 'freedom of the will'... Hmmm.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Calvin Johnson is used not as a moral example to emulate by will, but as an illustration of what it looks like to 'belong to Christ' rather than 'Adam'.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: God sustained Johnson in prison.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and liberation from the burden of self-improvement.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative flows perfectly from the human predicament (Adam) to the divine solution (Christ) to the resulting identity (Baptism).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: undone the reign of sin, loosed the grip of death, broken through our prison walls

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses on Christ's work; the Spirit is implied in the 'belonging' through baptism.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a textbook example of a theocentric narrative where God is the Subject and humanity is the Receiver.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is the 'Grammar of Grace'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon masterfully avoids the trap of moralism by deconstructing the human 'will' and replacing it with the 'Free Gift' of God's cosmic intervention.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the Kosovo imagery; Greimas shows that Kosovo is merely the 'Opponent' in a deeper structural battle.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Rom 5; Greimas shows how the sermon's 'engine' actually functions to deliver the text's promise.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the sermon's power comes from the 'Subject-switch' from the failing human will to the victorious Christ.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Rutledge Rule' perfectly.
